description: From Middle English syften, from Old English siftan, from Proto-West Germanic *siftijan.

verbs.description: sift (third-person singular simple present sifts, present participle sifting, simple past and past participle sifted)

entries.meaning: To separate or scatter (things) as if by sieving.
[+object] (archaic or old-fashioned) To scrutinise (someone or something) carefully so as to find the truth.
examples: It immediately occurred to him to sift her on the subject of Isabella and Theodore.

entries.meaning: [+ through (object)] To carefully go through a set of objects, or a collection of information, in order to find something.
(computing, dated) To move data records up in memory to make space to insert further records.
